intro: Goodyera dawsonii, commonly known as the Dawson's plicate. It is a terrestrial orchid belonging to the family Orchidaceae, characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and intricate floral structure. Native to the eastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found growing on rock surfaces. The plant produces small, pale green to white flowers with three sepals and three petals, typically blooming in late spring. Goodyera dawsonii is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
